H0.text: which term is used to identify having official power to act. Jurisdiction

H1.text: which term is used to identify having official power to act. Dominion

H2.text: which term is used to identify having official power to act. Mandate

H3.text: which term is used to identify having official power to act. authority

A4.text: Jurisdiction is the legal term for the legal authority held by a legal entity to enact justice.

A5.text: If a nation does agree to participate in activities of the supranational bodies and accept decisions, the nation is giving up its sovereign authority and thereby allocating power to these bodies.

A6.text: A Supreme Court decision on Guantánamo Bay jurisdiction was archived in 2012.
